heading: Today
text: Sun, mixing with increasing clouds west to east. Becoming mostly cloudy through the St. Lawrence Valley and NY, with a few morning showers, then becoming likely late in the day, possibly some thunder.  Highs in the low to mid 70s.  Winds light, becoming south 10 to 15 mph, gusting 25 to 35 mph from the Green Mountains west.

heading: Tonight
text: Remaining partly cloudy east of the Green Mountains and south of Rt. 4 and Laconia.  Mostly cloudy west and north, with scattered to numerous showers or a stray thunderstorm.  Lows in the 50s.  Winds light east, and south 10 to 15 mph, gusting to 25 mph from the Green Mountains west, diminishing overnight.

heading: Tuesday
text: Showers spreading east from Lake George, Rt. 4, and the White Mountains north.  Any morning sun south giving way to clouds.  Scattered afternoon showers or a thunderstorm.  Highs in the upper 60s to low 70s north, 70s to near 80 south.  Winds light east, and south near 10 mph from the Green Mountains west, becoming light in the afternoon.
